Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Everolimus for Belatacept-Refractory Renal Allograft Rejection

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, peripheral mononuclear cells, serum creatinine levels, and renal biopsies were collected from 8 patients

Intervention.evidence: characterize CD8+ effector memory T cell (T_EM) populations before and after mTOR inhibition with everolimus

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to determine the mechanisms and treatment of rejection in kidney transplant recipients under belatacept-based early corticosteroid withdrawal following T cell depleting induction.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Everolimus treatment halted the in vivo proliferation of T_EM cells, reduced their ex vivo alloreactivity, and significantly decreased their presence in peripheral blood.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered at clinicaltrials.gov (#NCT01729494).
